imageGenerationPrompts.basePrompt: Create a [MONSTER_TYPE] character in the King of Tokyo board game art style with these specifications: Clean, bold cartoon/anime style with thick black outlines, vibrant saturated colors with cel-shading, slightly exaggerated proportions with larger head and expressive features, rounded friendly-yet-menacing design, simple but effective shading. Character should be anthropomorphic kaiju standing upright with large expressive eyes, distinctive silhouette, and mix of cute and intimidating elements. High contrast colors that work at small sizes, clear details for game cards, square/portrait orientation, dynamic pose showing personality.

mechanical.prompt: [BASE_PROMPT] MECHANICAL THEME: Robotic/cybernetic creature with segmented armor plating, glowing energy cores, metallic surfaces with scratches and wear, technological details like circuits or panels, steam/energy emissions. Color palette: Steel grays, electric blues, warning oranges, or chrome silvers. Personality: Calculated, powerful, technological superiority.

elemental.prompt: [BASE_PROMPT] ELEMENTAL THEME: Creature embodying natural forces with elemental effects around them (fire, ice, lightning, earth, water). Organic textures mixed with elemental energy, glowing eyes matching element type, environmental effects showing their power. Color palette based on element type. Personality: Primal, nature-connected, elemental fury.

mystical.prompt: [BASE_PROMPT] MYSTICAL THEME: Magical creature with arcane symbols, floating magical elements, ethereal aura or mist, crystalline or runic details, otherworldly features like multiple eyes or floating appendages. Colors should be rich and magical. Personality: Ancient wisdom, mysterious power, otherworldly knowledge.

organic.prompt: [BASE_PROMPT] ORGANIC THEME: Biological creature with natural textures like scales, fur, feathers, or chitin. Enhanced natural features, oversized claws/teeth/spines, tribal or primitive decorations, living environment details. Earth-tone color palettes with natural accent colors. Personality: Wild, instinctual, territorial, primal intelligence.

cosmic.prompt: [BASE_PROMPT] COSMIC THEME: Space-themed creature with starfield patterns, nebula coloring, cosmic energy trails, crystalline or void-based features, anti-gravity elements, stellar phenomena incorporated into design. Deep space color palettes with bright energy accents. Personality: Alien intelligence, cosmic awareness, otherworldly motives.

undead.prompt: [BASE_PROMPT] UNDEAD THEME: Reanimated creature with decay elements, exposed bones or mechanical parts, glowing soul-energy, tattered details, dark aura effects, gothic or horror elements while maintaining the cute-scary balance. Dark color palettes with supernatural glowing accents. Personality: Vengeful, persistent, dark humor, undying determination.

aquatic.prompt: [BASE_PROMPT] AQUATIC THEME: Sea creature with fins, gills, scales, tentacles, or shell features. Water effects around the character, bioluminescent details, coral or seaweed decorations, pressure-adapted features. Ocean color palettes with pearl or bioluminescent accents. Personality: Fluid, adaptive, territorial about water, deep-sea wisdom.

aerial.prompt: [BASE_PROMPT] AERIAL THEME: Flying creature with wings, feathers, or flight membranes. Wind effects around character, cloud or sky elements, streamlined aerodynamic features, bird or bat-like characteristics enhanced. Sky color palettes with wind and cloud effects. Personality: Free-spirited, high-perspective wisdom, swift and elusive, sky-territory focused.

insectoid.prompt: [BASE_PROMPT] INSECTOID THEME: Bug-inspired creature with compound eyes, chitinous armor, multiple limbs, antennae, or wing cases. Hive or colony aesthetic elements, geometric patterns, efficient design language. Vibrant warning colors or camouflage patterns. Personality: Efficient, collective-minded, adaptable, industrious persistence.

usage.instructions: Replace [BASE_PROMPT] with the basePrompt text, then replace [MONSTER_TYPE] with your specific monster concept. Use the color suggestions and examples as inspiration for your specific character design.
tips: Always maintain the kawaii-kaiju balance of cute and menacing
Ensure colors work well at small card sizes
Consider the monster's personality when choosing poses
Keep designs simple enough to read clearly as game tokens
Test color combinations for accessibility and contrast
